Class RunBank

java.lang.Object
RunBank
public class RunBank
extends java.lang.Object
Instructor: Daniel Mejia, Course: CS 3331 Lab Assignment: Programming Assignment 4 Description: The purpose of the concrete class RunBank is to implement the necessary methods to create and run a program that represents different activities that are typically done by a customer and a manager of a banking system. Honesty Statement: We confirm that the work of this assignment is completely our own. By turning in this assignment, we declare that we did not receive unauthorized assistance. Moreover, all deliverables including, but not limited to the source code, lab report, and output files were written and produced by my partner and I, alone.
Since:
July 15, 2020
Version:
1.7
Author:
Abel Carrasco and Alonso Monarrez

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void addNewBankUser​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase)
    A method that allows a bank manager to create a new bank user by entering the new user's customer and account information.
    static void clearOutputFile​(java.io.File outputFile)
    A method that clears the contents of teh given file.
    static int findLargestIdentificationNumber​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase)
    A method that returns the latest identification number recorded for the last customer added to the customers database.
    static int findLargestSavingsAcctNumber​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase)
    A method that returns the largest savings account number recorded for the last customer added to the customers database.
    static void inquireAccountByName​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase)
    A method that searches for a customer by name to retrieve and print all of the information of the associated account at the request of the bank manager.
    static void inquireAccountByTypeAndNumber​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase)
    A method that searches for a customer by account type and number to retrieve and print all of the information of the associated account at the request of the bank manager.
    static void logTransaction​(java.io.File logFile, Customer currentCustomer, java.lang.String transaction)
    A method that displays a customer's transaction to the transaction log.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    The main method in which users, such as a customer and a manager, interact with the program to perform various activities that are typical of a banking system, such as making monetary transactions, creating new bank users, inquiring account information, processing transactions from a file, and writing bank statements.
    static void printAllAccounts​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase)
    A method that prints the account information of all customers associated with the bank.
    static void readTransactions​(java.lang.String transactionsFile, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase, java.io.File logFile)
    A method that reads and processes all transactions from a file to update accordingly the account information of all customers involved in successful transactions.
    static void requestBalanceInquiry​(Customer validCustomer, java.io.File logFile)
    A method that prompts a customer to enter the information needed to process his or her requested balance inquiry.
    static void requestDeposit​(Customer validCustomer, java.io.File logFile)
    A method that prompts a customer to enter the information needed to process his or her requested deposit.
    static void requestPayment​(Customer validSender, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase, java.io.File logFile)
    A method that prompts a customer to enter the information needed to process his or her requested payment.
    static void requestTransfer​(Customer validCustomer, java.io.File logFile)
    A method that prompts a customer to enter the information needed to process his or her requested transfer.
    static void requestWithdrawal​(Customer validCustomer, java.io.File logFile)
    A method that prompts a customer to enter the information needed to process his or her requested withdrawal.
    static Customer searchAccount​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase, java.lang.String acctType, int acctNum)
    A method that traverses through the hash map of customers to find and return the account of the customer whose account type and number matches those given by the bank manager.
    static Customer searchCustomer​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName)
    A method that searches for a customer by the first and last names provided.
    static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> storeCustomersInfo​(java.lang.String customersFile)
    A method that reads a file containing the account information of several bank users and stores said information into a hash map of customers.
    static void updateBalanceSheet​(java.io.File balanceSheet, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase)
    A method that updates the original balance sheet by displaying all current customers' updated account information to a new balance sheet.
    static void writeBankStatement​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase)
    A method that writes a bank statement for a customer at the request of a bank manager who searches for said customer by name.

    • storeCustomersInfo

      public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> storeCustomersInfo​(java.lang.String customersFile) throws java.io.IOException
      A method that reads a file containing the account information of several bank users and stores said information into a hash map of customers. Taken from Alonso Monarrez.
      Parameters:
      customersFile - The original file of bank customers to be read.
      Returns:
      customersHashMap Returns a hash map containing customers' account information.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the bank users file cannot be found or accessed.

    • searchCustomer

      public static Customer searchCustomer​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase, java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName)
      A method that searches for a customer by the first and last names provided. Taken from Abel Carrasco.
      Parameters:
      customersDatabase - The hash map containing all of the customers associated with the bank.
      firstName - The first name of the customer to be searched.
      lastName - The last name of the customer to be searched.
      Returns:
      Returns the customer from the hash map whose name matches the one provided to the method.

    • readTransactions

      public static void readTransactions​(java.lang.String transactionsFile, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> customersDatabase, java.io.File logFile) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      A method that reads and processes all transactions from a file to update accordingly the account information of all customers involved in successful transactions. Taken from Abel Carrasco.
      Parameters:
      transactionsFile - The file containing the transactions to be read and processed.
      customersDatabase - The hash map containing all of the customers associated with the bank.
      logFile - The file to which the successful transactions are logged.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the transactions file or the log file cannot be found or accessed.
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index of an array cannot be accessed.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method in which users, such as a customer and a manager, interact with the program to perform various activities that are typical of a banking system, such as making monetary transactions, creating new bank users, inquiring account information, processing transactions from a file, and writing bank statements. These activities serve to display and update the bank's data based on the users' selection of activity. Taken from Alonso Monarrez.
      Parameters:
      args - The system arguments.
